snippet: Pakistan’s highest court said on Thursday it would charge Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani with contempt of court for refusing to reopen a corruption case against President Asif Ali Zardari.
abstract: Pakistan’s highest court says it will charge Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani with contempt of court for refusing to reopen a corruption case into the finances of President Asif Ali Zardari; court order significantly escalates long-simmering tensions between the judiciary and the government and threatens to plunge the country into fresh political turmoil as its leaders debate a new strategic relationship with the United States.
lead_paragraph: Pakistan’s highest court said on Thursday it would charge Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani with contempt of court for refusing to reopen a corruption case against President Asif Ali Zardari.

headline.seo: Pakistan Court to Charge Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani With Contempt
headline.main: Pakistan Court to Charge Prime Minister With Contempt
headline.print_headline: Court Plans Prosecution Of Premier In Pakistan
